result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Y Medina-Sifonte

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesus Y Medina-Sifonte not in court.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter appeared by video for Jesus Y Medina-Sifonte.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defendant is not present due to a medical emergency. Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request.  Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Summary Report received and filed.  nk
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.

Defendant Jesus Y Medina-Sifonte appeared by phone.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Jesus Y Medina-Sifonte. 
 Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Status Conference. Defense waiting for discovery in this case. State to follow up.
Court advised by the State this case was incorrectly tabbed to this court and should be transferred to Branch 11 due to a lower pending.
Court ordered case transferred forthwith and adjourned Branch 11 calendar.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services VIOLATION  Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 4, with same conditions as case 19CF864. 
-No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
-Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
-Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jesus Y Medina-Sifonte in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Dennis Patrick Murphy for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference due to Justice Point violation.  Defendant has DA warrant.  Court VACATES DA warrant.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz informs the court that Attorney Allison Marie Ritter has been retained by defendant for cases 22CF2979 and 19CF864.  Defense requested initial appearance and waives 20 day preliminary hearing.  Court grants defense request.  Initial appearance proceeded.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court hears arguments as to bail.  For reasons as set forth on the record, court orders $5000.00 signature bond with turnover to Justice Point Level 4, with same conditions as case 19CF864.  Defendant to report to Justice Point by August 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 11.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed by Attorney Allison Ritter.

Case scheduled for status conference, same date as defendant's other case 19CF864 for a Justice Point Violation; both parties agreed to date, via email.  Status conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
